1565420698_1GFU4qAMTFnQJ7W7r98Zj2xJWq1ev.body: It is implemented on some cloud drives. They scan users folder for files hashs and that way can found out if someone used to have cp etc. So yea there also must be big databases with hash list done of those images.

> [crazylime](#comment_19_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n): That appending of new hashes today begins with a process of "trusted" humans identifying the images then submitting it through a trusted and controlled process.  That becomes very difficult to distribute in a p2p world because w/o that central trust and control, you open the door to DOS attacks.  e.g., a bad actor could scan all images of a target site and submit the hashes even though none may belong in the category.   [...]

Yea..on here it would feel very much like starting point for some sort of censorship

> [r3naam3r](#comment_18_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw6zQxM): OK that's nice but there should be a GUI way to do it too, IMHO

you might be interested with multiuser plugin then
to activate it go into your core\plugins and rename disabled-Multiuser on Multiuser
then restart zeronet
as far as I remember
that will purge your ID each time and generate random one
you might have some problems though so I suggest reading doc
